definition: Weixin county in Zhaotong 昭通[Zhao1 tong1], Yunnan
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
Weixin county in Zhaotong 昭通[Zhao1 tong1], Yunnan
to lose every scrap of reputation

sentences.english: A teacher must show his authority.
sentences.chinese: 教員必須表現得有威信。

sentences.english: He suffered a loss of prestige when the scandal was publicized .
sentences.chinese: 這件醜事公開後他便威信掃地。

sentences.english: Be expert in human communication , have higher prestige in the schoolmate.
sentences.chinese: 善於人際交往，在同窗中有較高的威信。

sentences.english: Lhabu has made important achievements in Buddhist studies, and enjoys great popularity amongst other monks and lamas.
sentences.chinese: 拉布有較高的佛學造詣，在廣大僧衆中有很高的威信。

sentences.english: Your will become believable only after you have established trust among those in your community.
sentences.chinese: 只有你在你的社區建立了威信之後你纔會變的可信。

sentences.english: Katsura's prestige is not lost on contemporary Japan.
sentences.chinese: 桂的威信也不會喪失對當代日本。

sentences.english: The high prestige of the premier is radicated in the hearts of the people.
sentences.chinese: 總理的崇高威信在人民的心中樹立起來。

sentences.english: Here you can build a reputation for yourself competing with the best of the best.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏你可以與最厲害的人競爭，併爲自己建立威信。

sentences.english: John holds positional power, but he lacks the personal authority of a real leader.
sentences.chinese: 約翰位高權重，但缺乏一個領導人應有的威信。

sentences.english: She enjoyed high prestige among the masses.
sentences.chinese: 她在羣衆中享有很高威信。

sentences.english: He has high prestige among the masses.
sentences.chinese: 她在羣衆中享有很高威信。

sentences.english: He was the greatest player for Liverpool, and he's made an impact.
sentences.chinese: 他曾經是利物浦最偉大的球員，而且他有威信。

sentences.english: If the conditions of diminished awesomeness prevail, the people will not be victorious.
sentences.chinese: 缺少威信，就不能指揮士卒去戰勝敵人。

sentences.english: His enemies are spreading rumours to undermine his authority.
sentences.chinese: 他的敵人在散佈謠言來暗中破壞他的威信。

sentences.english: Winning respect enhances all you do.
sentences.chinese: 贏得尊重有了威信會讓你事半功倍。

definition: to lose every scrap of reputation
ability to have one's say and be listened to/influence/clout
